intro: Fagara multijuga, commonly known as the Jamaican pepper or mountain pepper, is a tropical shrub native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, white, fragrant flowers. Its fruit is a small, round berry that turns from green to red as it matures. Fagara multijuga is often used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory and antiseptic properties.
